title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Zechariah chapter 13 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Zechariah Chapter 13.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 13:1, what will be opened to the house of David and the inhabitants of Jerusalem?
options: A fountain for sin and uncleanness
questions.correctAnswer: A fountain for sin and uncleanness
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:1 states that there shall be a fountain opened for sin and uncleanness to the house of David and Jerusalem.

questions.question: What will happen to the names of the idols in the land according to Zechariah 13:2?
options: They will be cut off and no more remembered
They will be honored with festivals
They will be inscribed on tablets
questions.correctAnswer: They will be cut off and no more remembered
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:2 says the LORD will cut off the names of the idols and they will no more be remembered.

questions.question: Who will say 'Thou shalt not live' to a prophet according to Zechariah 13:3?
questions.correctAnswer: His father and his mother
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:3 states that the prophet's father and mother will say 'Thou shalt not live' if he prophesies lies.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 13:4, what will the prophets be ashamed of in that day?
questions.correctAnswer: Their vision and prophesying
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:4 says prophets will be ashamed of their vision and prophesying and will not wear rough garments to deceive.

questions.question: What occupation does the man claim to have in Zechariah 13:5?
questions.correctAnswer: Husbandman
questions.explanation: In Zechariah 13:5, the man says he is a husbandman and was taught to keep cattle from youth.

questions.question: In Zechariah 13:6, what is asked about the wounds?
options: What are these wounds in thine hands?
Where did you get these wounds?
Why do you hide your wounds?
questions.correctAnswer: What are these wounds in thine hands?
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:6 records the question 'What are these wounds in thine hands?' being asked.

questions.question: What does the wounded man say about his wounds in Zechariah 13:6?
options: Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends
questions.correctAnswer: Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:6 says the man answers that the wounds were received in the house of his friends.

questions.question: Who does the LORD say to 'Awake, O sword' against in Zechariah 13:7?
options: My shepherd and the man that is my fellow
questions.correctAnswer: My shepherd and the man that is my fellow
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:7 commands the sword to awake against the shepherd and the LORD's fellow man.

questions.question: What will happen to the sheep when the shepherd is smitten according to Zechariah 13:7?
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be scattered
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:7 states that when the shepherd is smitten, the sheep shall be scattered.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 13:8, how many parts of the land shall be cut off and die?
questions.correctAnswer: Two parts
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:8 says two parts shall be cut off and die, and the third part shall remain.

questions.question: What will happen to the third part of the people according to Zechariah 13:9?
options: They will be refined and called my people
questions.correctAnswer: They will be refined and called my people
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:9 promises the third part will be refined and recognized as God's people.

questions.question: True or False: According to Zechariah 13:2, the unclean spirit will remain in the land.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:2 says the LORD will cause the unclean spirit to pass out of the land.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 13:4 states that prophets will continue to wear rough garments to deceive in that day.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:4 says prophets will not wear rough garments to deceive in that day.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 13:9 promises that the LORD will hear those who call on His name.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:9 states that those who call on the LORD's name will be heard.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Zechariah 13:5: 'I am no prophet, I am an ______; for man taught me to keep cattle from my youth.'
questions.correctAnswer: husbandman
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:5 says 'I am no prophet, I am an husbandman; for man taught me to keep cattle from my youth.'

medium.title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Zechariah Chapter 13 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 13:1 teach us about forgiveness and cleansing through God in our daily Christian walk?
options: God provides a fountain for cleansing from sin and uncleanness
We must earn forgiveness through our works
Forgiveness is only for the priests
questions.correctAnswer: God provides a fountain for cleansing from sin and uncleanness
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:1 speaks of a fountain opened for sin and uncleanness, symbolizing God's provision for cleansing and forgiveness available to all who trust Him, encouraging personal devotion and repentance.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with false teachings in their church. Based on Zechariah 13:2, what biblical truth about spiritual purity could you share?
options: God will remove false prophets and unclean spirits from the land
False teachings are acceptable if they bring peace
Prophets are always to be trusted without question
Unclean spirits have no impact on believers
questions.correctAnswer: God will remove false prophets and unclean spirits from the land
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:2 promises God will cut off idols, false prophets, and unclean spirits, emphasizing the importance of obedience, vigilance, and trust in God's cleansing power in church life.

questions.question: How should parents respond to a child who falsely claims to speak for God, according to Zechariah 13:3?
options: They should reject false prophecy even from their own child
They should always support their child's words
They should let the community decide
questions.correctAnswer: They should reject false prophecy even from their own child
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:3 shows that even a father and mother must not tolerate lies spoken in God's name, teaching the importance of integrity and truth in family and spiritual discipline.

questions.question: What does Zechariah 13:4 teach about humility and honesty in spiritual leadership?
options: True prophets will be ashamed of false visions and not deceive others
Prophets should wear special garments to show authority
Prophets are above reproach and always correct
Deception is acceptable if it benefits the community
questions.correctAnswer: True prophets will be ashamed of false visions and not deceive others
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:4 encourages humility and honesty, showing that genuine spiritual leaders do not use deception or pride but acknowledge truth and avoid misleading others.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 13:5 encourage believers about work ethic and integrity?
options: A man taught to keep cattle from youth should embrace his honest work
Only prophets have value in God's kingdom
Work is secondary to spiritual matters
Farming is a lower calling than prophecy
questions.correctAnswer: A man taught to keep cattle from youth should embrace his honest work
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:5 shows that honest labor, like husbandry, is honorable and valued, teaching believers to embrace their daily work with integrity and faithfulness.

questions.question: In a conversation about suffering and friendship, how can Zechariah 13:6 guide understanding of wounds and trials?
options: Wounds in the house of friends symbolize the pain that can come from close relationships
Physical wounds are the only important suffering
questions.correctAnswer: Wounds in the house of friends symbolize the pain that can come from close relationships
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:6 illustrates that sometimes pain and trials come from those close to us, teaching perseverance, forgiveness, and humility in relationships.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 13:7 teach us about the cost of following Christ and the importance of perseverance?
options: When the shepherd is struck, the sheep will scatter, but God remains sovereign
Following Christ guarantees an easy life
The shepherd's suffering is unrelated to the followers
questions.correctAnswer: When the shepherd is struck, the sheep will scatter, but God remains sovereign
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:7 acknowledges difficulties in following Christ (the shepherd) but encourages trust in God's control and perseverance through trials.

questions.question: Based on Zechariah 13:8, what can believers learn about enduring hardships in faith communities?
options: Many will face hardship, but a faithful remnant will remain
Faith communities should avoid suffering at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: Many will face hardship, but a faithful remnant will remain
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:8 teaches that trials will affect many, but God preserves a faithful third, encouraging perseverance and hope within church life.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 13:9 illustrate God's refining process for believers through difficulties?
options: God refines believers like silver and gold through trials to purify their faith
Only perfect believers are accepted by God
Refining means immediate reward without suffering
questions.correctAnswer: God refines believers like silver and gold through trials to purify their faith
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:9 compares God's refining of believers through fire to the refining of precious metals, teaching trust in God's discipline and growth through trials.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 13:3 indicates that family members will always support false prophecy if it benefits them.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:3 states that even parents will reject a child who prophesies lies, emphasizing the importance of truth over personal or familial loyalty.

questions.question: True or False: According to Zechariah 13:5, a person can honestly deny being a prophet and instead embrace their vocational calling with integrity.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:5 shows a man who denies being a prophet and identifies as a husbandman, highlighting the value of honest work and humility in daily life.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Zechariah 13:1 says, 'In that day there shall be a ______ opened to the house of David and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem for sin and for uncleanness.'
questions.correctAnswer: fountain
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:1 uses the metaphor of a fountain for cleansing and forgiveness of sin, teaching believers about God's provision for purification and grace.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 13:2 encourage believers to trust in God's justice regarding idolatry and false prophecy?
options: God will cut off idols and false prophets so they are no longer remembered
Idols will remain but be ignored
False prophets will eventually be honored
God tolerates idolatry for a time
questions.correctAnswer: God will cut off idols and false prophets so they are no longer remembered
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:2 assures believers that God will remove idolatry and false prophecy, reinforcing trust in His justice and the call to obedience.

questions.question: Based on Zechariah 13:4, what attitude should spiritual leaders maintain about their prophetic visions and teachings?
options: They should be humble and ashamed if their visions are false
They should boast about their prophecies
They should use deception to gain followers
They should wear distinctive clothing to show authority
questions.correctAnswer: They should be humble and ashamed if their visions are false
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:4 highlights humility and honesty for prophets, discouraging deception and pride in spiritual leadership.

questions.question: What practical lesson about honesty in work and identity is given in Zechariah 13:5?
options: A man should honestly claim his true occupation rather than falsely claim to be a prophet
Everyone should strive to be a prophet
A man should reject all work except prophecy
questions.correctAnswer: A man should honestly claim his true occupation rather than falsely claim to be a prophet
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:5 teaches believers to embrace integrity by acknowledging their honest work, promoting humility and faithfulness in daily labor.

hard.title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Zechariah Chapter 13.

questions.question: In Zechariah 13:1, what is the significance of the 'fountain opened to the house of David and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem'?
options: A source of cleansing for sin and uncleanness
A river flowing through the city
A well for physical water supply
questions.correctAnswer: A source of cleansing for sin and uncleanness
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:1 describes a fountain opened for sin and uncleanness, symbolizing purification and forgiveness for the people.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 13:2, what will happen to the names of idols and the prophets in that day?
options: The names of idols will be cut off and forgotten; prophets and unclean spirits will be removed
The prophets will be exalted above all
Idols will be worshiped openly again
questions.correctAnswer: The names of idols will be cut off and forgotten; prophets and unclean spirits will be removed
questions.explanation: Verse 2 states that God will cut off the names of the idols and cause the prophets and unclean spirits to pass out of the land, indicating a purging of false worship and spiritual corruption.

questions.question: What is the cultural and familial reaction to false prophecy described in Zechariah 13:3?
options: Parents reject and kill their own son who prophesies falsely
The community gathers to honor the false prophet
False prophets are exiled to foreign lands
The king decrees a pardon for false prophets
questions.correctAnswer: Parents reject and kill their own son who prophesies falsely
questions.explanation: Verse 3 shows a severe familial rejection where parents say 'Thou shalt not live' to their son if he prophesies lies, indicating the seriousness of false prophecy in that context.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 13:4 describe the attitude of prophets toward their visions in that day?
options: They will be ashamed and no longer wear deceptive garments
They will boldly declare their visions
They will wear special robes to show their status
questions.correctAnswer: They will be ashamed and no longer wear deceptive garments
questions.explanation: Verse 4 indicates that prophets will be ashamed of their visions and will not wear rough garments designed to deceive, which implies a rejection of false or misleading prophecy.

questions.question: What occupation does the false prophet claim in Zechariah 13:5 to deny his prophetic role?
questions.correctAnswer: Husbandman (farmer)
questions.explanation: In verse 5, the individual denies being a prophet and claims to be a husbandman, emphasizing a return to an ordinary, honest livelihood instead of deceitful prophecy.

questions.question: In Zechariah 13:6, what is the significance of the wounds in the hands of the man questioned?
options: They are wounds received in the house of his friends
They are marks of a criminal
questions.correctAnswer: They are wounds received in the house of his friends
questions.explanation: Verse 6 describes wounds in the hands as those received in the house of his friends, which can be interpreted as betrayal or suffering amongst close associates, foreshadowing the suffering servant motif.

questions.question: What does the command 'Awake, O sword, against my shepherd' in Zechariah 13:7 foreshadow in the New Testament?
options: The striking of Jesus, the good shepherd, leading to the scattering of his followers
The conquest of Israel by foreign nations
The destruction of Jerusalem by the sword
The rise of a military leader in Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The striking of Jesus, the good shepherd, leading to the scattering of his followers
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:7 foreshadows the passion of Jesus, the shepherd who is struck, causing his disciples (the sheep) to scatter, as referenced in the Gospels (e.g., Matthew 26:31).

questions.question: According to Zechariah 13:8, what proportion of the land's inhabitants will be cut off and die?
questions.correctAnswer: Two parts out of three
questions.explanation: Verse 8 states that two parts shall be cut off and die, which reflects a severe judgment leaving only a remnant of one third.

questions.question: What is the purpose of refining the third part 'as silver is refined' in Zechariah 13:9?
options: To purify and test the people so they may call on God's name
To separate them from the Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: To purify and test the people so they may call on God's name
questions.explanation: Verse 9 uses the metaphor of refining silver and gold to indicate purification and testing of the faithful remnant who will then call on the LORD and be recognized as His people.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 13:2 prophesies that false prophets will be honored and remembered in the land.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:2 clearly states that the names of idols will be cut off and not remembered, and that prophets and unclean spirits will be removed from the land.

questions.question: Which literary device is prominently used in Zechariah 13:7 to illustrate the relationship between the shepherd and the sheep?
questions.correctAnswer: Metaphor
questions.explanation: The shepherd and sheep imagery in verse 7 is a metaphor representing the leader (shepherd) and his followers (sheep), a common biblical motif.

questions.question: How does the theme of purification in Zechariah 13:9 connect to the broader prophetic tradition in the Old Testament?
options: It parallels the refining of Israel's remnant through trials as seen in Malachi and Isaiah
It suggests a physical cleansing ceremony for priests
It refers to agricultural purification rituals
It depicts a cleansing of the temple vessels only
questions.correctAnswer: It parallels the refining of Israel's remnant through trials as seen in Malachi and Isaiah
questions.explanation: The refining imagery in Zechariah 13:9 aligns with prophetic themes in Malachi 3 and Isaiah 1 where God purifies His people by trials, leading to spiritual renewal.

questions.question: What is the significance of the refusal of prophets to wear 'rough garments to deceive' in Zechariah 13:4 within its historical context?
options: It rejects the common prophetic disguise associated with false prophecy in ancient Israel
It mandates a new dress code for priests
It encourages prophets to wear royal robes
It emphasizes humility through simple clothing
questions.correctAnswer: It rejects the common prophetic disguise associated with false prophecy in ancient Israel
questions.explanation: Rough garments were often worn by false prophets to appear authoritative; verse 4’s rejection of such attire signifies exposing and ending deceptive prophecy.

questions.question: In Zechariah 13:6, the phrase 'wounded in the house of my friends' can be understood as an allusion to what New Testament event?
options: The betrayal of Jesus by Judas Iscariot
questions.correctAnswer: The betrayal of Jesus by Judas Iscariot
questions.explanation: The wounds in the house of friends evoke the betrayal Jesus experienced from Judas, one of His closest companions, as described in the Gospels.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Zechariah 13:5 shows a prophet denying his role by saying 'I am no prophet, I am a _______; for man taught me to keep cattle from my youth.'
questions.correctAnswer: husbandman
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly states 'I am no prophet, I am an husbandman,' emphasizing a denial of prophetic office.

theological.title: Zechariah Chapter 13 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Zechariah Chapter 13 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 13:1, what is opened to the house of David and the inhabitants of Jerusalem for sin and uncleanness?
questions.correctAnswer: A fountain
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:1 speaks of a fountain opened for sin and uncleanness, symbolizing cleansing and forgiveness. This echoes New Testament themes of purification through Christ (Hebrews 9:22, 1 John 1:7, Revelation 1:5).

questions.question: What will the LORD cut off from the land in Zechariah 13:2?
questions.correctAnswer: The names of the idols
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:2 states that the LORD will cut off the names of the idols, removing idolatry, consistent with the biblical call for exclusive worship of God (Exodus 20:3-5, Deuteronomy 12:3, Isaiah 42:8).

questions.question: In Zechariah 13:3, what will a prophet's own parents say to him when he prophesies falsely?
questions.correctAnswer: Thou shalt not live
questions.explanation: Zechariah 13:3 reveals that false prophecy will be severely condemned even by close family, highlighting God's intolerance of falsehood (Deuteronomy 18:20, Jeremiah 23:30-32, 1 John 4:1).

questions.question: According to Zechariah 13:4, what will happen to prophets in that day when they have prophesied?
options: They shall be ashamed of their vision
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be ashamed of their vision
questions.explanation: The verse reveals that prophets will be ashamed of their visions, indicating the rejection of false or misleading prophecy, aligning with biblical warnings against false prophets (Jeremiah 14:14, Ezekiel 13:3, Matthew 7:15).

questions.question: In Zechariah 13:5, how does a false prophet describe himself to avoid persecution?
questions.correctAnswer: An husbandman
questions.explanation: The false prophet denies his prophetic office and claims to be an husbandman (farmer), showing a denial of false prophecy as in Jeremiah 23:21, Ezekiel 13:3, and Matthew 13:57.

questions.question: What is the answer given about the wounds in the hands in Zechariah 13:6?
options: Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends
questions.correctAnswer: Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends
questions.explanation: The verse depicts the paradox of suffering inflicted by those close, reflecting Christ’s betrayal and crucifixion (Psalm 41:9, Zechariah 11:12-13, John 13:18, Luke 22:48).

questions.question: What command does the LORD give concerning the shepherd in Zechariah 13:7?
options: Awake, O sword, against my shepherd
questions.correctAnswer: Awake, O sword, against my shepherd
questions.explanation: God commands the sword to strike the shepherd, leading to the scattering of the sheep, foreshadowing Christ’s suffering and the scattering of His followers (Matthew 26:31, John 10:11, Isaiah 53:6).

questions.question: According to Zechariah 13:8, what fraction of the land's people shall be cut off and die?
questions.correctAnswer: Two parts
questions.explanation: The LORD says two parts shall die, but a third will remain, indicating judgment and preservation, paralleling themes of purification and remnant in Scriptures (Isaiah 6:13, Romans 11:5, Jeremiah 30:11).

questions.question: What will happen to the third part left according to Zechariah 13:9?
options: They will be refined as silver and tried as gold
questions.correctAnswer: They will be refined as silver and tried as gold
questions.explanation: This verse symbolizes purification and testing by God, consistent with refining imagery in Proverbs 17:3, Malachi 3:3, 1 Peter 1:7, and Revelation 3:18.

questions.question: What will the refined third part do, as stated in Zechariah 13:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Call on God's name
questions.explanation: The refined people will call on God's name, showing repentance and faith, consistent with Joel 2:32, Romans 10:13, and Acts 2:21.

questions.question: What does God say He will declare about the refined people in Zechariah 13:9?
questions.correctAnswer: It is my people
questions.explanation: God affirms a covenant relationship with the purified remnant, echoing Exodus 6:7, Jeremiah 31:33, Romans 9:25-26, and 1 Peter 2:10.

questions.question: What will the refined people say in response to God in Zechariah 13:9?
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is my God
questions.explanation: The people’s confession reveals faith and allegiance to God, consistent with Deuteronomy 6:4, Psalm 95:6, and Romans 10:9.

questions.question: In Zechariah 13:2, besides cutting off the names of idols, what else will the LORD cause to pass out of the land?
options: The prophets and the unclean spirit
questions.correctAnswer: The prophets and the unclean spirit
questions.explanation: This verse indicates removal of false prophecy and evil spirits, emphasizing God’s cleansing work, consistent with 1 John 4:1, Matthew 7:15, and Acts 5:3.

questions.question: How will false prophets be identified in Zechariah 13:4?
options: They will not wear a rough garment to deceive
questions.correctAnswer: They will not wear a rough garment to deceive
questions.explanation: The verse rejects the stereotypical prophetic disguise used for deceit, paralleling Ezekiel 13:18 and Jeremiah 23:16 about false prophets.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'Awake, O sword, against my shepherd' in Zechariah 13:7 symbolize?
options: The coming suffering and death of the Messiah
questions.correctAnswer: The coming suffering and death of the Messiah
questions.explanation: The sword striking the shepherd is a messianic prophecy of Christ’s passion and the scattering of his followers, as seen in Matthew 26:31, John 10:11, Isaiah 53:6.
